intro: Mapouria chaenotricha, commonly known as the hairy mapouria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Mapouria chaenotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
